page.title: 05FARMING AT FROXFIELD GREEN-2
page.content: The crops grown are many and are mainly wheat and barley with varying 'break-crops'. These do not use as many nutrients from the ground so providing a break. The crops to make a break are oats, oil-seed-rape, linseed oil, peas, beans and grass. These are grown about every third year, and rotation of crops at the farm is; winter-barley, oil-seed rape, and winter wheat twice , then a break crop. A large amount of money is spent on artificial fertilizers and chemicals. About Â£16 - 20,000 a year. All of these are in liquid form so cutting expenses. The E.E.C. affects all farms in the area through milk quotas, corn prices and controls mainly the type of farming. Farming in the area is changing. The farmers and the public are becoming more aware of the need for conservation.
